contentrichtext.text: '''Ynys Bery''' is a small [[island]] south of [[Ramsey Island]], [[Pembrokeshire]], [[Wales]]. It is the site of a [[shipwreck]]: the ''S.S. Graffoe'' (a 2,996-ton [[steamship]] bound from [[Glasgow]] to [[Buenos Aires]] with [[coal]]) struck Ramsey Island and sank at the northern end of Ynys Bery in 1903. It lies at a depth of 15 metres, and is one of many Pembrokeshire wrecks popular with [[diving|divers]]. Ynys Bery's highest point is 72 metres. == External links == *{{gbmapping|SM700220}} {{coord|51.84909|N|5.34084|W|region:GB_source:enwiki-osgb36(SM700220)|display=title}}<!-- Note: WGS84 lat/long, converted from OSGB36 grid ref --> {{Pembrokeshire}} [[Category:Islands of Pembrokeshire]]
